review: I've been going to Red Robin since I first discovered one in Oregon about 12 years ago. The thing that really struck me is I wandered in 10 minutes before closing. They not only seated and served me, they were just so cool about it. Since then I've been going to the one on Richmond & Rogerdale way back when the cinema was still there. We have a favorite bartender, Jorge, who always treats us great. And I can still walk in 10 minutes before closing and they will still cheerfully seat me and serve me (to the extent the kitchen is open). Then tragedy strikes! (sort of). Turns out the food allergy that I suspected was to dairy turns out to be (dum dum dum) to gluten. The good news is I can eat ice cream! The bad news is, well, will I ever be able to eat out again? Can I haz Cheezburger? Then I read not only does RR have a gluten free bun, it's the best gluten free bun on the planet! And since their burgers are already par excellence, off we go to RR. And you know what? They're wonderful and I can eat burgers and they're sensitive to celiacs and I can get fries and salad and fruit and all is good in the world. The burger I got was a limited edition, the Chimi Fresco. It was awesome. I can't get beer, but whatever. I'll have ice cream.

I must say the staff were beyond superb. The really know how to make you feel comfortable. The menu is extensive  but they helped you work around what is just right for you . The zucchini appetizer is delicious and their fires were absolutely fantastic. We had a lot of laughs with the staff and recommend it to anyone who want a scrumptious burger and a great atmosphere.

Their food is good but their to-go service is terrible. I probably order from them about once a month and do curbside pickup. I truly cannot think of one time they have gotten my order perfect. Missing ranch, no plastic ware, wrong burger toppings... They are also sooo slow. I will select pickup for noon, come in at 12:15, and then still be waiting 10+ minutes. And they're not even busy.

I don't swing by here as often as I used to ever since the Tinseltown closed, but this is still a great place to grab a burger on a lunch break, or to hang out with friends.  They've revamped their menu to include premium burgers and "Tavern Doubles" (smaller, cheaper options), but at their core they're still a diner with good classic burgers, fries, and milkshakes, plus a bar. The last couple of times I've swung by, I've gone straight to the bar area and ordered there.  The bartender is usually busy with multiple customers, but is quick to take care of everyone.  They're always friendly, and service is usually quick.  The only knock on this place is that they seem to serve a smaller amount of fries every time I come.  I mean, I get that it's unlimited and I can get more, but why use that as an excuse to serve me less up front? There are better burgers in Houston, but if you want a classic place where you can go with a group and also grab an alcoholic beverage (besides a beer), there are few better options in town.

Red Robin is hit or miss.  One week they will be spot on, food perfect great customer service.  Then the next time it takes 30 minutes to get a burger that is undercooked. The new curbside pickup is unorganized and you might as well go inside if you want your food hot (still a 10 minute wait)

This was my first time trying it out, I actually really enjoyed our food. But the service was horrible, the waiter would not come around.  At one point one of the managers I believe since he was wearing a dress shirt had to come and help us with the order. I had to also go to the bar and ask for napkins since they never gave us any. I would recommend the restaurant but at a different location, maybe the service there would be better. Overall the food was great, they serve bottomless fries with your order, even though we weren't able to get more since no one was around. It was delicious, hopefully if I ever come again the service will be better.

i have  TRIED to give this place the benefit of the doubt BUT......THE BURGERS HERE ARE DISGUSTINGGGGG. OMG. i have 3 different ones at work for lunch, but.....all is lost. the burgers are either not cooked well or properly...or they give you AN OLD BURGER. also...the steak fries are HORRENDOUS....and are usually cold.  yuck yuck yuckkkkkk. forget it. I can't try anymore. I have officially given up on Red Robin. ewwww.
I ordered a black and bleu burger with a Guiness but got told they were out, of Guineas until the bartender found a lone bottle.  The burger was good and the beer nice and cold

This is one of my quick lunch spots for a good burger. I tried their new Smoky Jack Tavern Double Burger which was very good. It was two fire grilled patties with smoky campfire sauce, bourbon-infused whiskey river BBQ sauce, melted pepper jack cheese, pickles, red onions and lettuce all on a sesame seed bun! Nuff said.... I got mine minus the lettuce..... this burger was GREAT. Full of flavor. A must try.

I have never eaten here before. It Was awesome. The general manager Chris was a top of everything. The other manager hosted us. Our server was knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. Food: We ordered grilled cheese, Prime Rib dip, Blue Cheese burger...garlic cheese fries, sweet potatoes fries...all Great. Ranch dip was yummy.  Our fries & drinks were bottomless. An amazing.  I have to recommend it and I will be back!!

I went twice this week, basically had the same thing. Appetizers were very good and reasonable. I had a good $3 side salad wedge, with 2 changes no ranch but honey mustard, no blue cheese but cheddar. Had wings. My quest had a cheese burger and fries, and enjoyed it. Went again with kids, burgers tavern and turkey with avocado with purple lemonades - both kids said way too sweet. I had my salad and wings again. This time the waiter did not ask boneless or bone in? I got boneless which I really don't like, kids ate them I got a second side salad. So, 1st time 4 stars second time 3!
I've eaten there a few times and each time the food has been good as was the service.  I really enjoy their Guacamole Bacon burger as well as their Avo-Cobb-O salad. :)

Our server wAs so great!!  Thank you so much, Andrell.  It was pleasure having you as our server!!!! Great smile and so very helpful.   Food, excellent (as expected ). The new ordering device was still working out the "kinks" Four stars due to the new devices.

Food was really good. I got a burger with Mac and cheese and my fiancé got the whiskey river burger. Both were very good and of course the fries were awesome. I like that the fries are bottomless because they're just so good! The food was great but service was only so-so. Fiancé wanted another round of fries but once our food was dropped, the server never came back. But, overall, the visit was good.
They're customer service sucks They needed my order up twice and finally 2 hours later it was cold and nasty not very friendly when trying to get it fixed
Still a fan, they do such a good job with to go orders.  Love the new happy hour wedge salad...delicious.

Pretty good with burgers.  Chili Cheese fries not too good, nice on the cheese...chili needs some work. The River Whiskey burger great! Not to fond of the chips with hot wings, chips needs to be fries. Menus are sticking and smuggy.  Nice service and could use some table cleaning  our first table had ants or some kind of small black bugs.  Overall a good burger restaurant, wish I could eat more, so full.

These burgers are so awful. I requested Swiss instead of cheddar and that was ignored. Our fries came out cold and old. A new round had to be ordered. I would never eat here ever again. My girlfriends coke smelled like sewage from the way cups had to have been washed. These are the worst burgers I have ever had. Fuddruckers are ten times better.

I must say for this place to  be a busy at lunch the service was great.  I was seated immediately the server offered food menu item sugestions.  The whiskey river burger was tasty.  During my visit I order  Tropical Mai Tai which was strong and fruity.  Overall worth returning.  Btw I was alone and the restaurant was clean.  Good job Red Robin!

Menu has been updated and have fresh green and tasty salads. They still have their tower of fries and now added tower of donuts.  The green leaf substitute for buns on the burgers was amazing and healthy. Great place to have lunch with Co workers. The level of loudness is high and I must admit staff is always on top of everything.

I have been here several times with coworkers during lunch. There are a lot of people usually but there is usually no wait. We had a friendly waitress and she took our orders promptly. The only complaint I have is that it took a little longer for the food to come out. The burgers are pretty good, and I love their steak fries. You can substitute with garlic and herbs fries for additional price (a dollar). I had the lonestar burger and I was definitely stuffed by the end! Couldn't finish all my fries! Prices are a little higher than I'd like for the quality of the food and service.
In and out to go service. I got a raspberry limeade and large fry. The fries come in a small $1.99 or large which is 1lb for $4.95. The fries were good but could have used a little more seasoning.

I'll get my burger fix elsewhere. This Red Robin is exactly what you'd expect. The burgers are decent but everything else seems kind of...meh. Red Robin has really overhauled there menu with plenty of new burger option. The last couple of times I've had the Southern Charm burger and it's pretty good. I tried some of my sister's chicken tenders and they did not taste fresh at all. Service at this location wasn't terrible but also wasn't great, which is crazy because the restaurant was very busy. I typically only come here on Father's Day or my Dad's birthday and after my recent visit, that probably won't change.

My boyfriend and I walked in on Saturday night expecting to enjoy bottomlesss fries. To our dismay, we stood and sat for 15 minutes, as their 2 "Please wait to be seated" signs instruct, and were never seated. The restaurant was not busy, as we were the only ones waiting to be seated. Servers walked by us several times, looked at us, and didn't say a word. Finally, one server, who had walked past us several times, asked us if we needed help. My boyfriend nodded and said yes, and she just walked away and continued what she was doing. I look over and see 2 other servers hanging out at the bar chatting with customers. We finally had enough and walked out. Never have we experienced this at any other restaurant.

I can't front, I've been wanting to try this place out for a while now...Finally went and it was pretty decent The menu was a little weird to me...I guess they had it setup so you can choose from regular burgers and their gourmet burgers. Appetizers didn't really appeal to me, but overall the burger was pretty good for the price. I would call Red Robin a "souped" up  Sonic with a bar. A fair rating of three stars....

First time visiting RR.  We are from El Paso, Texas and are in Houston for personal reasons.  We've seen commercials on cable tv back home and decided to visit for the first time.  The service was mediocre but the food was great.  Spoke to manager when he sat us down and we told him that it was our first time, he welcomed us and reviewed the entire menu, kudos to him.  Our sever however was not all in and took for ever to refill our drinks and bring out condiments and our bottomless fries.  Very discouraging since the other 2 servers on the floor portrayed the same attitude and energy.  Atmosphere needed some music or tvs since we could of heard the conversations of other patrons if we wanted to.  Overall I would recommend it probably on a weekend with much more livelier servers, we visited on a Monday.

You know if a place is good if you come in pack especially at lunchtime. Indeed the burgers are first rate tastefully good. The ambiance of the place the movie posters and pictures of movie legends make this a place for the whole family. Love it.

My family and I have been coming to this location for years and always so pleased with the food and the service. However, in the past six months or so, it's been awful on both counts. The waiters are very slow and not very attentive to our needs and the food just isn't what it used to be. There is never really a crowd, so it seems ridiculous to wait for nearly 40-50 minutes for your food.  I am truly disappointed at the way this restaurant is changing. I have driven the 30 minutes to the restaurant many times - sometimes in horrible traffic, which adds another 15 or so minutes. However, I no longer feel it's worth it.  It's all American food, so there are lots of other choices closer to home. Hopefully they just have a bad management team and will soon change out, so things can get better again. I may try again in about six months to see if that rings true.

Came here on a Thursday night and it was pretty empty. We were sat immediately, however it took a good 6 minutes for a server to come and even get our drink orders. When he did, he was not very engaging, and sort of mumbled. Drinks did not take long to get. We proceeded to order when he returned. My bf specifically asked if they had the crab cake burger because the Katy location is always out. He assured him that they had them, and took his order. I ordered a salad, and specified no cucumbers and no bacon. Can you guess what happened? So about 20 minutes go by, no, literally 20 minutes. How do I know? Because I was texting my mother, and looked at my phone to confirm. A manager approaches our table to tell us that they "looked high and low" and did not have any crab cake burgers.  Soooo...it took 20 minutes to figure this out? It is CERTAINLY not as if the place was packed - there were about 5 tables filled. And I mean tables of 2 or 3 people... As she walked away with his NEW order, a female server comes to our table telling us that she was now our server as our previous one was leaving....umm ok. As a member of the service industry myself, I thought that was pretty shitty of them, shows very little respect for customers. I've never seen that personally, you always have to wait until your last table leaves, just the way the cookie crumbles... So, as we received our chili, which was the highlight of the night, we kept seeing our first server, seemingly doing nothing. The manager seemed oblivious to our frustration. When sh brought my salad, it had bacon AND cucumbers on it, and while I was super angry I said that I would pick it off. Afterall, I had waited about 30 minutes for my damn food to begin with!! I do not eat pork, and found it to be shitty, yet again, that they got that part wrong. I will CERTAINLY never be back. Shame on you, Red Robin. Also, we were sat at this tiny littl table for 2, when the waitress came to check on us, she never took a single item off of the table. We were crowded and there were empty plates and cups...just terrible.

Stacey was our server she was friendly & so bubbly. I ordered the Burnin Love the fried Jalapeño on top was so good. I had nth to complain about the burger was juicy the onion rings were hot & fresh..

Awful.  Do NOT order the Pretzel Bites--inedible.  They tasted like hot soggy pumpernickel dough balls overly salted to the point of being gross.  Served with a small pot of cheese that can't help the taste. As for everything else, the only things I like are the fish and chips and the fries.  Thank god the fries bottomless.

Burgers and steak fries are same ol' good, and the Chili Chili Cheeseburger is back!   My chili burger is topped with flavorful chili with black beans, and the burger is well seasoned and perfectly cooked to medium with some pink inside! Yummmmm~  Equally worth mentioning is the great service!  My server Kathy is such a nice, helpful lady. I like her!
I was on business and ate here 2 nights in a row.  1st night the service was great! 2nd night slow to take order but food was good both nights!

I moved down the street from Red Robin a few months ago and decided that I may never try it because, 1. Houston has better food than chain restaurants, 2. It has 3 stars on Yelp, and 3. Anybody can make a burger. Wow, was I wrong. I ordered the Prime Chophouse burger with a cup of French Onion soup and got the chipotle aioli and garlic aioli dipping sauces on the side. The French Onion soup was so-so, nothing to write home about. But the burger was cooked perfectly, the onion bun was warm, fluffy, and flavorful, and the horseradish sautéed mushrooms were great. Although I ordered my meal to-go, I noticed the atmosphere was comfortable and roomy, as well as family friendly. Solid choice for an inexpensive meal.

I should've just stuck to getting food to go from here. Just literally walked out after waiting 10 minutes for service and a glass of water, and I was only one of two people sitting at the bar. Lesson learned. Sweet potato fries are good though! Just not worth the wait.

Burger patties have shrunk, prices gone up, service still the usual inattentive.  That pretty much sums it up. The meat patties used to be a lot thicker. They will still let you get it cooked medium rare though which a lot of places won't do. The burgers used to be a definite 2 handed meal. Now they have made them genuinely "gourmet" and shrunk them down to mere shadows of their former selves. I see that they want to make the toppings the star of the meal but you still want a decent sized patty of beef.  Every time they redo the menu they jack the prices up a buck or two. They now have a fancy topped burger with ciabatta bread for $13. I can get 2 Whataburger full meal deals with everything including a fistful of napkins because it's so damn huge for $15. So if you are looking for value THIS is not your best bet in the neighborhood. They offer lots of different burgers for $9-$13 and you can customize them with your choice of cheese, guac, bacon, gluten free rolls (upcharge) and sometimes this location gets those changes and additions right. Usually not, but sometimes they do on the first try! I would say 7 times out of 10 I have had to send my Sammy back to get it topped with what I ask to be on it. I won't deny that the food is tasty. I do like their relish, their cobb salad is still one of my favorites and am still a fan of the freckled lemonade ($5 bottomless). They have a full bar and usually some nifty cocktail ideas.  Their steak fries are bottomless too and if you want something besides ketchup now they have an assortment of dipping sauces for them - or to smear on your burger. I honestly tried the spicy ketchup (eh), Red's Secret Tavern Sauce (1000 island mixture) and the thai sauce (firey but sweet) and found none of them to be better than some good ol' ketchup. But it was nice to have the choices. You can get veggie burgers and chicken. The kids menu is a nice value for $5-$6. It includes corn dogs, pizza and the like with some nice side choices besides the fries...stuff like fruit and apple slices. Onion rings now come in the huge tower size and a smaller version which is much better for two folks to share. It's a sit down place where kids are welcome. It's clean and the food is good. But with prices continuing to go up and serving sizes continuing to go down I doubt I'll be frequenting this Red Robin as often as I used to.

I only ate here once, the burger was pretty good and so were the fries. There was some orange creamsicle adult beverage that I really liked. I definitely need to go back for that.. The service was good too
I love the bacon cheeseburger is great I tried others food there not so good there Mai Tai's are the best drink there and don't forget the appetizers are great as well

My last visit wasn't so great, but in general I'm a fan of Red Robin. The freckled lemonade is different and so tasty. Probably full of sugar, but also fiber ;) The last time I went my friend and I ordered an appetizer of fried mozzarella and zucchini. The zucchini came in nice large wedges, and was very good. The mozzarella was typical. I had the Whiskey River burger this last time; I've ordered once with chicken instead, and I think that is much better. The last visit the burger was just so greasy the bottom bun was completely flattened and soaked. There may have also been other sauces, but really seemed to be mostly grease. I think next time I might try one of their burgers on a ciabatta bun. I also had a side of the aioli, which I think was garlic aioli, but mostly tasted very herby. Not bad, just not what I was expecting/wanting. One of my friends really likes their burger with pineapple. Desserts look great, but have never had room to go that far... Service has always been friendly and good.

Ok, this is a burger joint. They specialize in burgers and do it real well. Their selection is good and the burgers are good size though if you get their tavern burgers they are smaller. They have endless fries which is nice. The place is pretty relaxed and my only real reason for giving them 4 stars is they can be a bit pricey. Then again their burgers are worth it but I cannot bring myself to give them 5 stars when I look at my bill.

I really like this location, the servers are really nice but professional and my food always come hot and great tasting. I hope this locations keeps up the good work, my favorite burger is the red robin burger.

1. Service - excellent, can't complain. Great every time I come. The managers have the waitstaff trained to service all the same. They frequently check on you and they always carry a smile. It's an A-La-Carte system, wait to be seated, order at the table, and pay at the end.  2. Price - about $11-$30 a person. For the few times I've been here, it's always some sort of hamburger or chicken sandwich. You can't buy a burger or sandwich for less than $10. But with all this being said, it's worth it. About average for price.  3. Ambiance - dress code here is casual. The place is very relaxing. A cool hangout spot with friends or family. Large enough for parties. Jeans and flip flops are ok! 4. Food - I'm quite simple, a Lone Star Burger is my favorite. What's even better are their bottomless fries. Meaning, you pay for a tray of fries and they keep refilling at no extra cost!  5. Cleanliness - clean tables and restrooms, but their menus are a bit sticky during Rush hours. Can't really fix that, but something I've noticed.

Its definitely declined in both the quality of the food as well as the service. While I can be more understanding of a waiter/waitress being less accommodating if the establishment is busy - I am not if its empty. I would expect the service / attention to our party to be better. They got one of our simple orders wrong and didn't show any remorse. You can definitely do better than here no matter your food preference.

I could not taste the meat. It was hidden underneath all that sauce and the portion size was small. Disappointed for such a high price. $15 is way too much.  I could have had better at a bunch of different places.
Very mellow....good selection of food and shakes...more then burgers. Staff on point!We will go back**

Great place to go if you are a glutton or if you feel gluttonous.  Unlimited fries, sweet potato fries also available, a billion types of various burgers to choose from, a menu that allows you to VERY EASILY  customize your meal to meet you dietary needs, and a great decor.  Decent prices.   This place rocks!  (The back of the menu explains how to manage your dietary needs, and how to cut or to watch your calories and more.)  Free food on your birthday!  You need to join their loyalty program in advance but then you can get free food on your birthday.  Burger and desert.  Did i mention the unlimited fries? I just wish they had corn syrup free ketchup. ...  to go with the unlimited fries....Sigh. ( GREAT customer service. )  music not too loud, has a full service bar, happy employees.  I don't think i will ever live in any other city that doesn't have a Red Robins.  (Well,  with exception of cities in Hawaii or Alaska, then all bets are off!)

The food is consistent. The servers are always pleasant and friendly. The prices not so much. A regular hamburger and fries will set up back from about $12.00. They do have bottomless fries so that is a plus.

We go there regularly and service has progressively gotten worse to the point that tonight was the last straw. The food isn't worth the hellish service. We were seated, ignored for 15 minutes (only 1 other couple seated in our section, rest of the place was equally dead), finally a waiter named Chris realized we hadn't been waited on, took our order (Chophouse Burger combo and an Avo-Cobbo Salad) and then said he would figure out who was supposed to be serving our section. He brought us our drinks immediately. We then waited and waited and waited, until Laura, our actual server came by and said "Your food will be ready in a minute" and then walked off. And we waited. Food finally shows, not served by Laura. That server refilled our drinks.  Laura was walking around but never came to check on us. My boyfriend had to flag her down to get another drink refill and to ask for more fries. Those fries never came. We finally flagged her down and asked for a to-go container for my salad and our check. We waited. She comes back with the to-go container but said we had to wait for "Someone else" to get our bill. Beyond frustrated. We get our bill, I pay cash and we wait forever for change. This was just an absolutely horrible restaurant experience because we were just flat out ignored. I ended up tipping Chris instead of Laura, because at least he tried to help us!
One of the moist juiciest burgers ive had before the burnin love burger was my favorite and the raspberry limeade to die for

Burgers are ok.  Always busy for lunch hour if you work in the westchase area. They serve bottomless steak fries.  I wanted to eat healthy & tried the  turkey burger. Not healthy at all. It was greasy & packed with sodium. Don't get me wrong the burger was good but if you want to eat healthy avoid this burger. I believe they serve vegetarian burgers too.  The French onion soup isn't too bad. I would choose fudruckers or pappas burgers over red robins.

I ordered the Smoke and Pepper Burger.  The burger was excellent even though I did not care for the sauce.  The half pound burger is actually too much for one person and I think I would have enjoyed the burger more if it was only one third pound.  The bottomless fries with the special camp fire sauce were excellent. The service was excellent. I really enjoyed the food and service, however the menu prices prevents me from wanting to pay a visit more than I would like.
Got the Gluten Free Bacon Burger and the accommodated my Gluten Free needs. Our server was fantastic too, will definetly be back!

Food is always pretty standard with great burgers, service is usually good, and you can get in and out pretty fast for lunch.  Today, however, there was a deal breaker.  My co worker was in the ladies restroom when she witnessed an employee use the facilities without WASHING her hands because she was too busy texting on her phone.  Her position was unknown but the sign says "ALL EMPLOYEES MUST WASH HANDS BEFORE LEAVING RESTROOM".  Oh well maybe she was a hostess but still, I'm not going back to find out.  Chili's here I come!!!
Burger was good. Minus the second patty I ask for.. Cod fish sandwich was good minus the cheese I ask for. Garlic fries was good both times... Lol
The bottomless freckled fruit salad is amazing with the wrappin California club. All the fruit you can eat is right up my alley. Hubby and my kiddo love the bottomless fries!!!

Before I review I must state that I am most definitely shocked by people stating this place has "Great" burgers!!!!,,, that is just a testament to fact that these people probably have never been to bubbas burgers !!! That is the place if you want an awesome buffalo burger!!

I was there yesterday with some of my friends for Veterans Day, and there was a humongous flying roach in the restaurant, landing on tables, food, etc. Our server was embarrassed, and tried to get the manager in duty, Mike to come and handle the situation. The manager ignored her, then lied to us by telling us that the waitress never informed him about the roach. Even after we talked to the manager, he still didn't handle the roach situation. I'm reporting them to the health department today. That was unacceptable, and sadly, they just thought it was ok to have a roach land in folks food without taking action. Disgusting.

Food is always great and the kind waiter working the bar is awesome, his name is Marco, he always keeps us satisfied and never asking for things twice! Fast service and the restaurant setting Is laid back!

We went to Red Robin on Richmond with my family and the food was wonderful as usual. The service was a little slow but overall a good experience. I had the half wrap and soup and everything came out pretty and delicious. I will be back!

Red Robin is what it is - a chain burger place with okay burgers and some clever topping combinations. My kids love coming here and other than some inattentive servers, we pretty much have a good time. I do like their app which allows me to customize my food choices to reduce calories.
Slow service. Water took an hour in between all visits to the table. Food cold and undercooked. Asked for burger well, came out rare.
Great tasting burgers. Nothing extraordinary! However, I am in love with their chicken tortilla soup and bottomless fries. With ranch please!
Upon return, I thought the food and service was better Good burgers and tasty fish sandwiches.  Good value drinks during happy hour, and applies to margaritas and beers as well

Stay away!!! The service is beyond slow!!!!!!! Been here almost two hours and only ordered 1 app and 1 burger! Took forever to have the order even place then waited forever for the app and again for the burger!!! It was not busy and have had wonderful service and faster when it was packed w/ a waiting line!! I'm just glad we decided to share a burger so we wouldn't have to wait even longer! The Lone Star burger was very good, the Yukon chips appetizer was too salty to eat. The restroom was soooo filthy I just turned back around and looked for someone to get our check. We will never go back to this location!

The food was good but the service was terrible. It took way too long for my food to come out. I also asked the waiter for a refill, which he never brought out to me. He kept checking on the other tables while ignoring me. I'd make eye contact and look right at me and he kept ignoring me. After about 30 mins of being ignored, I got antsy, got up, walked over to him at the bar, and asked him to give me my check. Totally unacceptable and he did not apologize. I complained to the manager and even the manager was abrupt and would barely let me talk although he did say he'd cancel the charge because of the lack of service. I'll never go to this location again.

Every time I've ever eaten here, I've come out feeling like someone tried to drown me in a kiddie pool filled with lard.  I just felt so...*greasy*. Tastewise, things aren't so bad -- in fact, he first bite is admittedly pretty good.  I mean, hot, juicy fat squirting between your teeth can pack a lot of flavor.  But by the end, I just feel awful.  Everything feels so heavy and como-inducing.  Blech. Service has always been ok.  And if you can take advantage of it, the fries are bottomless.  So that's a plus, I guess.

We just ordered carry out - I ordered the Guacamole Bacon Burger and he ordered the Whiskey BBQ Burger.  My burger barely had any guacamole on it, which is the main reason I ordered it.  His was lacking BBQ sauce.  Both of our meals were MEH.  On top of that, our stake fries were cold and dry.  :(  Boo Richmond Ave Red Robin!

Like I said the standard of this place has gone down.  Wieht my family here on 2/17/2013 for lunch. I had the prime chophouse burger today; instead of fried I got the side steam broccoli.  I forgot to take a picture of it; about five pcs. Of tinny broccoli inside of sauce cup. For a $10 burger, I expect to get at least a cup size side order.  I had to ask kitchen to redo my burger.  It was left under the light too long. The bread was hard n dry.  I don't know what went wrong, I did not touch my burger about 5 ms after it arrived to my table; why my cheese wasn't melted? So, I touched the meat n yes; kind of cold.  You know, I could have just go to get a hot, warm n tasty burger from dollar menu.  I only visit this location once a year n I have my reason n you all should know why now.  I guess Red Robin just lost me n my family as customers. Let me know when you can make my $10 burger worth what it cost n I will be back.  Total bill today for 4: $74 before tip.

I've never had a problem with the food, until this visit.  I always order the same thing, and it's simple.  I jut get their regular cheeseburger.  No frills, nothing fancy.  I stopped in tonight before heading to work and ordered my usual.  The hostess even repeated my order back to me. I got to work ready to eat and my order is completely wrong.  It's some weird burger with things I didn't want on my burger, plus some weird sauce that smelled (and somewhat tasted) like dirty feet. Since I was at work it's not like I could do anything.  I'll be sure to double check my orders before leaving the building next time. Also, Something about the atmosphere here doesn't sit right with me.  Maybe it's because I'm not a big fan of the cluttered decorum.  Plus, no matter what time of day I'm here, it always seems loud.  No matter how busy or slow they may be.  On this visit, that could be attributed to the children in the game area who were screaming and running around unattended.

The food is okay but the service at this location is absolutely terrible. I was delivered the wrong item twice (had to send it back repeatedly) and each time it was WAYYY off. By the time the rest of my family finished eating I was still waiting on my food. Impossible to get refills. Just ridiculous. Save yourself the time and headache and stay away from this location.

I'd never been to Red Robin, so imagine my surprise when I walked in and found that it actually had table service - somehow that part of the concept had escaped me.  While I won't say I'll be coming frequently, that's more because its just not my thing than a failure of execution.  All in all, I'd have to say they do a pretty good job. I had the California chicken sandwich - grilled chicken with bacon and guac.  I was disappointed that the guacamole was basically a spread, where it was hard to taste, but the sandwich overall was decent.  The chicken was slightly dry, but ok.   Given the pride with which they offer their bottomless fries, I was happy to discover (only by asking) that one could have steamed Veggies as a side option.  Unfortunately,  the dish was way too laden with bell peppers and unseasoned, but I guess what do I expect when I order steamed veggies in a burger joint.  The fries looked good. Service was polite and attentive.

I'm not sure how this place stays in business.  The burgers are ok but everything on the menu is way overpriced. $15 for a burger, 5 onion rings and a soda plus tip. I will stick with Smash Burger.  Same burger at half the price.
Great burgers and endless fries. They have the largest selection of types to pick from.

We stopped by this restaurant because we had a $10 gift card. The restaurant wasn't very busy and we received very friendly service. Our server was sweet and helpful in making choices. She even recommended that my husband get a larger burger because the one he was going to get was pretty small. Glad he did. The portions were tiny. They do have "bottomless" french fries but we chose to just eat what we had and then leave. All in all this place was OK. I think it felt more like a sports bar and that if we were there with a group of people watching a game, it might have been better then "date night".
Good burgetrs, service is typically good, pretty croweded for lunch so make sure you get there before noon or you'll likely have to wait for a table.
i like the fact that the fries keep coming i got to have unlimited sweet potatoe fries yum. burger was also tasty

Stopped in for my veterans day burger.  The burger was pretty good, nice and juicy, the steak fries were as plain as you can get though.  Service was very nice especially for what seems to be a place that is just a step up from fast food.

My first visit, and I was pretty disappointed. The burger was so dang small, but the sweet potato fries were good! So essentially I paid $10.99 for good sweet potato fries! There are wayyyyy better burger joints all across Houston!!

I used to enjoy a burger with french onion soup on cold, wintry days in the past so I decided to stop in the other day.  I ordered a banzai burger and french onion soup and the food wasn't bad.  It wasn't great, but it wasn't bad either.  Then the check came.  For my girlfriend's and my burger plus the soup and two sodas was over $40.  Seriously?  for Red Robin?  No thanks.  The food's not that great and I'm getting tired of "gourmet" burger places that charge exorbitant prices because they put bacon or avocado on a burger and call it gourmet.  (Yeah, I'm looking at you, Fuddrucker's).

Bottomless Fries they say.  I say, if you order a burger, there is no need for bottomless fries.  I could barely eat my fries.  I saved them for after the burger and maybe ate 1 or 2 during the meal.  They are tasty fries, don't get me wrong, but the burger is plenty big that you don' t need them. The Guacamole Bacon Burger is wonderful.  The bacon is thick and crispy (but not burnt) and the guacamole is just the right consistency.  I wouldn't recommend wearing a white or light colored shirt if eating this burger as it is very messy. The Whisky River  BBQ Burger is also very good.  I do not believe you will be upset with any of their burgers, even the veggie burger. For the drinks, I've had the Sand in your Shorts (Chambord, vodka, Peach Schnapps, Midori, triple sec, orange juice, cranberry juice & sweet 'n sour) which is sweet but quite drinkable.  I've also had the Absolut Lemonade (Absolut Citron, amaretto and Minute Maid lemonade on the rocks), another mighty fine drink. They have outdoor seating that is covered and they have fans and misters for those hot summer days. The service has always been good and no matter who I have gone with, they've all enjoyed.

Today I experienced burger bliss.  For the first time i went to Red Robin.  The servers were excited about the products, and ESPN was on every TV(including the tv's on the floor and in the restroom)  Don't discount it as just another burger place, however, they have a great salad selection, and have expanded the menu to include delicious chicken.  Ok, It's still a burger place, but  I can see myself heading there for the big game, if I'm tired of the usual wings!  They have a spectacular Bar as well.

This Red Robin has service that is much better than the other location on Katy Freeway. I go here quite a bit since it is just down Rogerdale from my office. The service is always fast, and the food is made just right everytime I go in. On the few times I've been in after work, I enjoyed most of their specialty drink selections. They advertise bottomless fries, but due to the size (and sheer goodness) of their burgers, you won't need them. I ordered 2 trays and felt like at any minute my pants button was going to explode. If you find yourself in the area, swing by and have a burger. Oh and don't forget to sign up for their free birthday burger promo. It came in handy for me in August. Free burger and fries for no reason other than being born. Gotta love it.

I used to love this place because it was one of the only places I knew where you could get an egg on your burger but ever since smashburger opened I haven't been back.  Not only is smashburger cheaper, better, but most of all it's closer!!!
